lgp.core.environment

Class Environment<T>

  • lgp.core.environment.Environment<T>

  • public class Environment<T>

    A central repository for core components made available to the LGP system.

    An environment should be built by providing the correct components. The environment will maintain these components so that can be accessed by the LGP system from wherever they are needed.

    The components required by the environment are split into three categories:

    1. Construction components: Given to an environment at construction time.

    2. Initialisation components: Resolved internally given valid construction components.

    3. Registered components: Resolved manually by registering with an environment after construction.

    After an environment is built and all components are resolved, it can be used to initiate the core evolution process of LGP.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Environment

        public Environment(ConfigLoader configLoader,
                   ConstantLoader<? extends T> constantLoader,
                   OperationLoader<T> operationLoader,
                   DefaultValueProvider<? extends T> defaultValueProvider,
                   FitnessFunction<? super T> fitnessFunction,
                   java.lang.Long randomStateSeed)

        Builds an environment with the specified construction components.

        Parameters:
        configLoader - A component that can load configuration information.
        constantLoader - A component that can load constants.
        operationLoader - A component that can load operations for the LGP system.
        defaultValueProvider - A component that provides default values for the registers in the register set.
        fitnessFunction - A function used to evaluate the fitness of LGP programs.
        randomStateSeed - Sets the seed of the random number generator. If a value is given, the seed will be set, and will produce deterministic runs. If null is given, a random seed will be chosen.

      • registeredModuleUnsafe

        public <TModule extends Module> TModule registeredModuleUnsafe(RegisteredModuleType type)

        Similar to registeredModule, but may give a ClassCastException at the call site.

        The internals of the module retrieval system cannot guarantee that any casting will be done safely, and thus this method should be used with caution. The reason for its existence is to make life easier for those using the API through Java.

        Type Parameters:
        TModule - The type the module will be cast as.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of registered module to fetch.
        Returns:
        An instance of the module registered for the given module type.
        Throws:
        - When no builder has been registered for the type of module requested.

      • copy

        public Environment<T> copy()

        Produces a clone of the current environment.

        It should be noted that because an environment instance has its own RNG associated with it, when making a copy, it is required that the copied environment have its own RNG too. To fulfil this requirement, when an environment is copied, it will initialise a new RNG that is seeded with a seed given from the RNG of the environment instance performing the copy (confusing -- yes!).

        The main reason behind this complication is to ensure that there are no contention issues when multiple environment instances are operating in a multi-threaded context (e.g. through a class Trainers.DistributedTrainer).

        Furthermore, any modules that are registered with the environment being copied, will be updated so that the reference the correct environment instance (i.e. the copy). This ensures that while the module registrations themselves are shared between copies, when a module is accessed, it gets initialised correctly.

        Returns:
        A new class Environment instance that is a copy of that the method is called on.
        See Also:
        class Trainers.DistributedTrainer
